hackathon-description-text: hackBCA II is a high school hackathon at the Bergen County Academies high school in Hackensack, NJ. Come to learn how to code or about exciting new technologies that companies are unveiling. For more information, visit our website at

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Co-Founder of Levo League and Together10
Co-Founder and Head of Content at One Month
Program Manager of High School Education, Martin Trust Center for MIT Entrepreneurship

hackathon-rules:
Please visit our rules page at 
.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Admission and Trip to HackNTU & 4 Razer Keyboards Phone Cases & Paid Github Accounts
4 Pebble Watches & Phone Cases & Paid Github Accounts
Raspberry Pi's & Phone Cases & Paid Github Accounts
chance for 2 teams to pitch & connect with Rough Draft Ventures for mentorship and opportunity for funding to work on their ideas post-hackathon.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=200 Hackensack Avenue, Hackensack, NJ 07601, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Coding ain't always easy. Make sure to look at the effort the team put into the project
Is the hack original? The team's project is a new and different or they've reinvented an old idea and given it a new perspective.
Is this hack going to be helpful? Does it have purpose? Will it have a positive impact on anything?

hackathon-description-header: hackBCA II is one of the biggest high school hackathons in the nation! Learn about coding or exciting new technologies that you can use.
